sentences.en: In Florida alone, hatchling losses number in the hundreds of thousands every year.
sentences.cn: 仅在佛罗里达, 每年由于孵化而造成的海龟数量的减少就已成百上千.

sentences.en: Lohmann speculates that hatchling turtles may imprint on the magnetic field of their home beach and, if so, such a phenomenon could be the basis of strategies for species preservation.
sentences.cn: 罗曼推测，人工孵化的海龟也许会留下它们家乡海滩磁场的烙印，如果是这样，这种现象可能会成为物种保护的策略基础。

sentences.en: Mother carried hatchling to water, urges them to swim.
sentences.cn: 妈妈携带刚孵化的幼仔到水边, 敦促他们下水.

sentences.en: The mom took the hatchling to a river and urged them to swim.
sentences.cn: 妈妈带着刚孵化的幼仔到河边，敦促他们下水。

words.tran_cn: 孵化；策划（hatch的过去分词形式）
[禽] 孵化；给…加影线；策划（hatch的ing形式）

trans.tran_cn: 人工孵化的鱼苗或小鸟
trans.tran_en: a young animal that has newly emerged from an egg
